subject: Career
title: The Streisand Effect: When Hiding Backfires
description: A 60-second lesson on The Streisand Effect: When Hiding Backfires.

hook.text: Barbra Streisand sued to hide a photo of her home. The lawsuit made millions view it. Now it's a principle.

buildup.text: Attempting to suppress information often draws far more attention to it.

discovery.text: In careers, this means aggressively hiding a failure or gap often makes people investigate more.

twist.text: A resume gap explained casually as 'I took time for family' is fine. Avoiding it seems suspicious.

climax.text: Own your narrative. Brief, honest explanations disarm curiosity. Secrecy fuels it.

punchline.text: The more you hide, the more they look.

quiz.question: What is the Streisand Effect?
options: Trying to hide information draws more attention to it
